data.title: Fix spelling of function name
data.body:
This commit fixes three small spelling mistakes:
- `relaseTextures()` -> `releaseTextures()`
- `caculateFinalPositionWithRelativeWidget()` -> `calculateFinalPositionWithRelativeWidget()`
- `caculateFinalPositionWithRelativeAlign()` -> `calculateFinalPositionWithRelativeAlign()`

Thanks for your work on this engine. :relaxed:

data.title: Fix nullptr when Android app enter background
Fix cannot add view to mFrameLayout when extends Cocos2dxActivity
data.body:
Cause class org.cocos2dx.lib.ResizeLayout is private. So activity class extends from Cocos2dxActivity will not know mFrameLayout variable, can't do anything with it. So make ResizeLayout public and move class into separate file. 

I meet the issue with Android Studio project.

data.title: Fix a fatal bug in EditBox implement for platform win32
data.body:
@zilongshanren @WenhaiLin  
Very sorry to say that, I found my PR (https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/13206) has a fatal bug.
In the earlier version, the Win32InputBox is a modal dialog box, and it would block rendering, then I use a timer to do rendering in that PR. However, there is a fatal error, i.e., main loop of Director was re-entered.
For example, when the dialog box is not yet closed, and try to remove the EditBox in a schedule, it will crash.

This PR uses modaless dialog box, which avoids re-entry, and won't crash any more.
I've done a series of tests, such as removing an EditBox in a schedule, in a Callback action, etc.

Please do some more test before merging.
Sorry trouble you.

ParticleSystemQuad   emitter:setStartColor(cc.c4f(1,1,0,1))  应该显示成为黄色的粒子，但是效果是绿色

translated by google: "It should show become yellow particles, but the effect is green"

data.title: cocos2dx 3.9-lua TMXTiledMap has black lines when role move
data.body:
I create a scene with TMXTiledMap scrollview, when role moves and view scrolls, there are black lines appear between tileds.

I tried set CC_FIX_ARTIFACTS_BY_STRECHING_TEXEL=1 in the ccConfig.h

and cc.Director:getInstance():setProjection( cc.DIRECTOR_PROJECTION2_D )

the map still jitter when scroll.

I tried:

```
local map = ccexp.TMXTiledMap:create( string.format( "map/%s.tmx", mapName ) )

　　local tmxLayer = map:getLayer( "layerName" )

　　tmxLayer:getTexture():setAntiAliasTexParameters()

```

But compiler tips layer and map does not have the "getTexture" method.

data.title: fix bug: updateVerticesForLOD always update vertices to vertex buffer
UILayout clipping issue
3.81版本 lua的严重bug
data.body:
3.81版本 lua有个非常严重的bug:     两个继承于Node的A与B       1. 在layer的init里  new A add A,  2.在onTouch时 new B    removeA  3.再次touch时 removeB     此时一定会挂在Node的析构函数这一句CCASSERT(!_running, "Node still marked as running on node destruction! Was base class onExit() called in derived class onExit() implementations?");

我分析在step2    new B    与   removeA 这里，c++的内存分配上有问题，把A的内存分配给了B   导致了最终的奇怪crash

data.title: [ci skip] Update the reference of submodule cocos2d-console.
Added the ability to set physics debug color of Shapes & Joints
data.body:
This pr adds the ability to change the physics debug color of the Shapes fill and outline. 
You can also change this on the PhysicsBody itself to change the color of all its shapes. 
Additionally, you can also set the line and point color of Joints

data.title: Wrong behaviour of the UserDefault class
data.body:
Egnine version: Cocos2d-x 3.8
The issue is, when any data with the key, which is not correct as name of an XML tag, is being put into the UserDefault class on Windows (and on ony other platform which is using the default tinyxml2 data backend), the XML file gets corrupted (the root "userDefault" node gets removed from the document). It makes impossible to continue working with that UserDefault file. I think that there should be some assertions/exceptions/etc which wouldn't let using those keys, or at least this thing should be somehow documented.

```
UserDefault::getInstance()->setIntegerForKey("here/is/a/wrong/key", 1917);
assert(UserDefault::getInstance()->getIntegerForKey("here/is/a/wrong/key"), 1917); // false, the program exits
```

Well, I would also recommend to use arrtibute value for keys, so there wouldn't be such troubles.
